title.narrative: Delivering quality lifesaving and age-appropriate sexual and reproductive health (SRH) services to vulnerable pregnant mothers, women and girls in drought-affected locations.

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide sexual and reproductive health (SRH) services to vulnerable communities as well as to support people affected by gender-based violence (GBV). This UNFPA project aims to support four health facilities that provide SRH and GBV services, conduct mobile outreach campaigns, and organize refresher trainings on the Minimum Initial Service Package (MISP) for Reproductive Health in Crisis Situations for health care providers in the drought-affected locations, among other activities. This project provides life-saving SRH assistance to 21,298 people, including 18,104 women, 426 men, 2,768 children, and 102 people with disabilities. It also targets 703 people for life-saving GBV services, including 639 women, 63 girls, and 13 people with disabilities.

description.narrative: Ensure the provision of Clinical Management of Rape (CMR) and Care for GBV survivors in the EmONC facilities

H.8 Number of primary healthcare consultations provided (focusing pregnancy related complications and family planning counselling)
RH.1 Number of live births assisted by a skilled health personnel
